intro: Acmispon subpinnatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Acmispon subpinnatus is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix nitrogen in the soil through its root nodules.
